sentences.sContent: ...In spite of the potential of machines to replace workers...
...Societies that cannot replace their populations discourage investment and innovation...
...hospital and military army to replace the work of man...
...The head technician in the lab tried to persuade the hospital administration to replace it...
...I have to warn you that it would take quite a while to force management to replace the old machines and attempt to get you transferred may or may not be successful...
...Because the administration is more likely to replace me than an X-ray equipment...
He replaced the book on the shelf.

synos.tran: 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

words.tran: 可替换的；可置换的；可放在原处的
更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员
可替换性，替代性；置换能力

trans.tranOther: to put something back where it was before
